134501.name: Bridge Constructor
134501.description:
With Bridge Constructor the player becomes an engineer in bridge building. In many different levels the player creates bridges over deep valleys, streets or rivers and crosses them with a truck or by car. For the constructions different components with different qualities are available. Each component has physical qualities and the whole construction will be under load from gravity immediately after the creating process.

Source: The Developer Website.

134503.name: Rollaway
134503.description: Rollaway is an abstract dice game about picking the right time to play whatever actions you roll. The interaction of six simple actions (win, lose, skip, double, give, and take) produces a rich variety of gameplay. A die that normally scores one point could earn you four, or could be taken away. You might use a skip-die to prevent the next player from giving you a burdensome lose-die, or you might take the lose-die so you can pass it on to someone else. Rollaway is simple to learn, highly interactive, and provides hours of lightly strategic fun.

134504.name: Struck
134504.description:
Struck's shape shifting checkerboard will offer new and puzzling challenges with each game you play. To win, all four of your playing pieces must occupy the four goals at the opposing end of the board.

The amount of moves each player will make during their turn is determined by the roll of the unique Struck Die. A "move" can be one of three actions: move a playing piece, change the color of a playing piece, or change the color on the checkerboard. By rolling three or higher, all actions can be used during a turn.

134505.name: Soul Ladder
134505.description:
From the in-game instructions:

YOU HAVE BEEN CURSED!

You have until midday of Day 29 to reclaim the Soul Orb and reverse the curse or you will DIE! In the meantime, every step you take across the land will infect it and start its change back to its original form.

To move about the land you will need to answer "ordering" questions. Four answers will be presented to you - one will move you 1 square, one will move you 2, one will move you 3, one will move you 4. Choose wisely.

You will need to become strong enough to defeat the Dragon. Try honing your skills in combat.

Your hierloom weaponry and armor is lost to you. There may be people willing to sell you replacements...

You will need a Soul Shard to bypass the magical barrier. You only know of one type of creature that carries them, and they won't visit the land in its current state...

The more your curse affects the land, the more powerful will be the random monsters you encounter.

134506.name: Argo Checkers
134506.description:
User Summary

Argo Checkers is a checkers game set on a wooden board with red and black pieces. It is played with the mouse, which becomes a pointing hand figure. The game will highlight which checkers can (or must) move and will indicate moves and turns with simple sounds.

134507.name: Aspetra
134507.description:
User Summary

Aspetra is a console-style RPG for the PC. At the beginning of the game, the protagonist arrives at the top of a mountain via a cloud; allegedly a wizard sent him, but the character has little recollection of facts and events. The character is named by the player through a conversation with an early NPC, who sets him on a quest involving wizardry, swordplay, and adventure.

The character is moved about with the arrow keys and can interact with objects and people. Most items can be either equipped or consumed.

134508.name: Spaceteam
videogamehonor: 2013 IGF Awards (Nuovo) Best Innovation of the Year Nominee
2013 IGF Awards Excellence in Design Nominee
2013 IndieCade Best Interaction of the Year Winner
134508.description:
A cooperative iOS and Android party game

Do you like pushing buttons and shouting at your friends? Do you like discharging Clip-jawed Fluxtrunions? If you answered yes, or no, then you might have what it takes to be on a Spaceteam!

Features

Teamwork
An untimely demise
Beveled Nanobuzzers
Auxiliary Technoprobes
Four-stroke Pluckers




Source: The Game Website.

Spaceteam is a cooperative party game for 2 to 4 players who shout technobabble at each other until their ship explodes. Each player needs an iPhone, iPad, or Android device. You'll be assigned a random control panel with buttons, switches, sliders, and dials. You need to follow time-sensitive instructions. However, the instructions are being sent to your teammates, so you have to coordinate before the time runs out. Also, the ship is falling apart. And you're trying to outrun an exploding star. Good luck. And remember to work together... as a Spaceteam!

Source: The Game Website.

134509.name: AfterTime: Survival
134509.description:
This four-player post apocalyptic board game leads gamers on the journey with Kai, making decisions that could impact the survival of the human race. In the aftermath of the apocalypse, survivors were forced to make decisions about how to rebuild our society. After Time: Survival follows the adventures of Kai, one of the lucky few who escaped from the crumbling civilization. But Kai's journey was not without its struggles, as he finds himself without a family, caring for a little girl who had lost hers as well, and is expected to lead a group of survivors in the rebuilding process. Faced with widespread hunger, dangerous weather conditions, and the dark temptations of personal greed, Kai's wits will be tested as he leads his group to a better life.

The board has a simple roll and move mechanic but when the players land on a "running Kai" space they draw a "Survival" card. On the card is a piece of the story that has an encounter that has two choices. The Player reads the card and then must choose an option and then turn the card over to see if they have earned community points or resource points. As they move around the board they might be hit by storms. The storms will set them back if they have no shelter token. Shelter tokens are earned when the player builds a community house.

Players compete as they race to amass resource points to build their own houses; but then the game takes a turn when they have to cooperate and negotiate with each other to spend and/or pool their community points to build community houses.

The winner of the game is the person who has been helpful enough to get all of the community houses built but has also balanced their own needs and has completed building their own five individual houses.

134510.name: Race of Champions: World
134510.description:
Take your chance to beat the greatest racers of motor sports in the official Race Of Champions cars and venues! Test your driving skills through a series of head-to-head races in identical cars on a parallel track, as seen in the actual ROC events.

Race Of Champions World, the sequel to Race Of Champions, brings back all the excitement from the first game and loads of new features.

Race Of Champions World features:

• 4 new venues, including 3 imaginary ROC tracks situated in New York, Los Angeles and Miami.
• 2 new officially licensed ROC race cars: the Artega GT and the Supersport GT.
• Paddock to customize cars
• Driver's Lounge to create your own avatar.
• Drive with the official cars and tracks of the event to be the best in the Championship, Duel and Challenge modes

Source: The Publisher Website.

134511.name: Escape of the Kre'null
134511.description:
This is a game of intense, steampunk-airship battle and daring rescue. Players work together to overcome an evil squad of airfoils while attempting to rescue The Grand Duchess from the battleship Kre'null.

Escape of the Kre'null is a strategic cooperative arial combat game where 1 to 4 players work together in an effort to reach The Grand Duchess while fighting off enemy airships. Upon reaching the Kre'null the players must search for, rescue, and escape with The Grand Duchess before being knocked out of the sky or failing to reach the Kre'null entirely.

The game allows players to:
- use various charts to create their ships
- select from over 12 game board layouts
- coordinate actions while dealing with various random events
- take turns making strategic decisions during aerial combat
- support the game's enemy AI system as it tries to defeat the players

All in a day’s work you say? What are you waiting for? Jump into one of the Naruil Airfoils and head off into adventure!

134513.description:
Venus: Forces of War:


For a thousand years the planet Venus has been violated by war. It was here that Nathaniel Durand, the first Cardinal of the Brotherhood, united the forces of mankind and led them to victory against the hellish forces of the Dark Legion. But now the Dark Legion has returned and once again nightmare demons threaten the very soul of humankind.

Venus is the domain of the Bauhaus Corporation and every day they struggle to maintain their hold on the richest world in the solar system. Wars rage in the depths of the sweltering jungle and fierce battles are fought throughout the darkness if the long Venusian night. But while the armies of humanity fight among themselves the power of the Dark Legion is rising once more and its terrible shadow threatens to engulf them all.


Includes:


Exciting campaigns illustrated with maps and comic strips all in full colour.
Detailed backgrounds on Venus and the Bauhaus Corporation.
New rules for jungle fighting and night fighting.
New Bauhaus army list detailing the forces of the four Duke Electors.
New Units such as the Vulkan Battlesuites amd the Bauhaus Strike Skimmers.
New Counters and templates all in full colour.
134513.name: Warzone: Venus – Bauhaus Forces of War

134514.name: Burning Opera (Game Chef 2012)
134514.description:
From the introduction: (typos in source)

You're all members of a drama group in Venice. All of you are rehearsing a play you're going to perform in the next days in "La Fenice" theater. All of a sudden a fire breaks out; due to the current renovation of the play house, alarm systems are out of service, so you're not aware of what's happening. The flames enclose the structure, and for you it's too late: doors won't budge anymore, and every fire exit is shut. You try to concretize: "someone will help us" you think. But as time passes, nothing happens but the flames devouring the structure more and more. The stage, the only perfectly intact area, is the place you choose to shelter yourself. Hope starts to fade away, so you decide to do a last, crazy thing: you act. You decide to play what you'd like to do right now, knowing you probably will die.

134515.name: Parsector 8
134515.description:
Game Manual

Parsector V is a space war game between two opponents. Two powerful motherships must be navigated through the galaxy conquering and owning parsectors. The motherships can launch three types of fleet battle craft: fyters, cruzers, and bases. The fyters and cruzers "jump" and attack enemy craft and capture parsectors. Bases are stationary and own the parsectors they occupy until they are destroyed. The motherships can fire high powered energy beams and short range weapon spreads. The game ends when one of the motherships is destroyed or one side has conquered 68% of the galaxy. You can move, shoot, and launch in any direction. A full 360 degrees are available. This is not an arcade style game, each side takes turns using up alloted time units. Fleet battle craft move at the end of each turn.

Parsector 8 is a tournament version of Parsector V. The computer opponent has been removed to allow 64 parsectors.

Special Features

1) Unique Split Screen- Using a screen divider hood each player has a private display. Your opponent cannot see your status and what your strategy is.
2) Action Sounds- Explosions, weapons, launches, and more.
3) Variable Galaxy Size- Galaxy size determines game length.

Launch a complete space force in minutes !!!!

134516.name: The New Starship Voyages
134516.description:
Game Manual

This is a "trek" type space war. You play the part of a starship commander. Your mission is to seek out and destroy the evil "Rogue" battle craft that have infested your galaxy. You have numerous options available. GOOD LUCK.

Special Features-
1. Action Sounds and Graphics.
2. Three weapon types.
3. Moving enemy craft.
4. 3D galaxy.
5. Six difficulty levels.

134517.name: Hypergate Centurion; Hypergate Patrol
134517.description:
Advertisement

You are the Hypergate Centurion, the guardian of the gateway to other galaxies. It is your sworn duty to protect the friendly military and cargo spaceships as they transit the hypergate. You carry out your mission nestled deep within the core of the Centurion Base Asteroid. You have at your disposal the centurion computer, a powerful plasma disruptor weapon, and a small but efficient fleet of patrol ships.

This is not a simple hand-eye coordination shoot'um down, but a highly sophisticated real time simulation requiring learned mental skills of decision and judgement.

Some features of Hypergate Centurion are: a cast of fifty different objects displayed in detail; four skill levels, from trainee to master; five quarrelsome alliances; and a detailed, thirty-two page instruction manual.

In Hypergate Patrol, you command a Hypergate Patrol Ship. You must contend with most of the same situations from Hypergate Centurion on a grueling ship to ship basis. The Centurion on Duty assigns you various missions; from rescuing stranded spacecraft to harpooning huge space monsters. You must also master the technique of hypergate navigation so that you can patrol the galaxies of the Local Super Cluster.

This is an intense, one-player, stop-action strategy simulation. It is written in BASIC but uses Machine Language subroutines for the explosion scenes and sound effects. Hypergate Patrol contains excellent action sounds and action graphics, four weapon types, numerous command options, and a multitude of combat and navigational aids.

134518.name: Mathable
134518.description: Mathable is essentially Scrabble played with number tiles instead of letter tiles. Certain squares on the board are marked with either an addition, subtraction, multiplication, or division sign and players must create equations by placing number tiles in a row on top of a basic function that combines them. Mathable was developed in 1985.

134519.name: BitQuiz
134519.description:
What color is Pac-Man? What was Nintendo doing back in the year 1800?

BitQuiz is a trivia card game sporting 500 questions on computer and video games where each card holds five questions suitable for anyone, with the Difficulty Mode ranging from Easy all the way up to Nightmare.

134520.description:
Phantom Leader – Solitaire

What’s New in the Deluxe Edition?
We have expanded and updated the original Phantom Leader game to the high standard set by our Hornet Leader game.

Increase the cards from 165 to 330
- All pilots get all 6 experience levels
- Add new aircraft: Air Force F-5, Air Force A-7
- Add more pilots for all aircraft types
- Add more Target cards
- Add more Special Event cards
- Revise the 6 original Campaigns to include the new Targets and Aircraft

Add Air Force and Navy Campaigns for the 1962 Cuban Missile Crisis

Upgrade to a mounted 11"x17" Tactical Display

Description:
Phantom Leader places you in command of a US Air Force or US Navy Tactical Fighter squadron in Vietnam between 1964 and 1972. You must not only destroy the targets but you must also balance the delicate political repercussions of your attacks. If you strike too hard, your air offensive might be put on hold, strike to light, and you’ll be blamed for losing the war.

Welcome to the Vietnam Air War!

Each of the campaigns can be played with either an Air Force or Navy squadron. The targets assigned to each service are different and change the complexion of the campaigns. Each campaign can be played with three different durations of: Skirmish, Conflict, or War.

Each mission takes roughly 30 minutes to set-up, plan, and resolve.

Each of your pilots has their own skills. Selecting the right pilots and weapons for a mission is vital to its success. As you fly missions, your pilots will gain experience and fatigue. With experience, their skills improve, but as their fatigue increases, their skills decrease and they might not be able to fly for several missions.

For those of you familiar with our modern era Hornet Leader series of games, you might be wondering what’s different about Phantom Leader…

The freedom of being able to select the best mission based on military objectives is something that is commonplace for today’s military. Back in Vietnam, the military was responsible for carrying out their orders, while at the same time being extremely limited in the weapons and tactics they were allowed to use to complete those orders. In many cases, the specific weapons, approach paths, and bombing altitudes were generated target-by-target at the White House. The mission specifics were then sent down the chain of command to the individual pilots flying the mission. As you can imagine, this was not the best way to run an air campaign.

Every target has a Political value. If you destroy it, you move the Political counter to the right a number of spaces equal to its value. As the counter gets moved to the right, your future target choices are reduced to those that are less politically sensitive. Which target you choose not to attack is also important. You get to move the Political counter to the left a number of spaces equal its Political value.

This means that while you might like to flatten a big enemy target and rack up the victory points, it might be better for you to choose a pointless target and move the Political counter in your favor instead.

Another difference is in combat power. For the last couple decades, the US Air Force and Navy have enjoyed air superiority due to training and technology. Such was not the case in the skies over Vietnam. The enemy had different, but just as capable, equipment. They also had the training and will to use it to its utmost.

They soon became aware of the limitations placed on the US forces by the politicians, and used those limitations to their advantage.

For example, at times, US pilots were not permitted to fire on enemy aircraft until they were visually identified. This negated any range advantage conveyed by the radar-homing AIM-7 Sparrow missiles. It was also a common limitation that enemy aircraft could only be attacked in the air. US pilots were not allowed to attack enemy airbases. US aircraft were also limited to flying predictable flight paths, at set times. This made setting up ambushes much easier for the enemy.

So, while you might be a Hornet Leader ace, Vietnam is a whole different ballgame!
134520.name: Phantom Leader Deluxe
boardgamepodcastepisode: OBG 113: Hey New Guy
TGG Episode 53: Romance of the Nine Empires, Dawn of the Zeds 2nd Edition, Phantom Leader Deluxe, Phil Lawrence of the Long Beach Comic and Horror Con, and More!

134521.name: Découvrir le Bas-Rhin
134521.description:
There is a Bas-Rhin in the game board what is a department of France.

Each player chooses a circuit (Architecture-Culture-History, Economics, Gourmet or Nature) and places his token on one of the places. Everyone gets three tourist tickets (1 point each) and must travel 20 cities on its circuit.

If player reaches a stage town, the player responds to a question. In case of right answer, the player receives 1 to 3 points depending on the difficulty of the question. Competitors move either box by box, or by using a special die to extend 2 to 5 space (do not exceed your goal).

The game ends when a player has completed his circuit.
The winner is the player who scores the most points on the tourist tickets.

134522.name: Decouvrir La Moselle
134522.description:
There is a La Moselle in the game board what is a department in the east of France named after the river Moselle.

Each player chooses a circuit (Architecture-Culture-History, Economics, Gourmet or Nature) and places his token on one of the places. Everyone gets three tourist tickets (1 point each) and must travel 20 cities on its circuit.

If player reaches a stage town, the player responds to a question. In case of right answer, the player receives 1 to 3 points depending on the difficulty of the question. Competitors move either box by box, or by using a special die to extend 2 to 5 space (do not exceed your goal).

The game ends when a player has completed his circuit.
The winner is the player who scores the most points on the tourist tickets.

134523.name: Découvrir La Marne
134523.description:
There is a La Marne in the game board what is a commune in the Loire-Atlantique department in western France.

Each player chooses a circuit (Architecture-Culture-History, Economics, Gourmet or Nature) and places his token on one of the places. Everyone gets three tourist tickets (1 point each) and must travel 20 cities on its circuit.

If player reaches a stage town, the player responds to a question. In case of right answer, the player receives 1 to 3 points depending on the difficulty of the question. Competitors move either box by box, or by using a special die to extend 2 to 5 space (do not exceed your goal).

The game ends when a player has completed his circuit.
The winner is the player who scores the most points on the tourist tickets.

boardgamehonor: 2015 Origins Awards Best Historical Miniature Rules Nominee
134524.description:
A set of medieval miniature wargaming rules intended for 28mm miniatures but playable in any scale.

Units consist of 12 foot or 6 mounted miniatures, which are used to fight out skirmish battles between armies of 4-6 units per side.

Units need to be activated by dice rolls which are easier to pass if you choose orders well suited to that particular troop type. For example, knights will charge more easily than other troops, and archers are easier to command to shoot rather than charge.

The rules are simple and to some extent they abstract medieval battle in favor of easy game play.
134524.name: Lion Rampant

134525.name: Agentes do Destino
134525.description:
"My life is mine?" is a cardgame themed on life. One player will be the protagonist of the game. He and all other players use cards to write the destiny of the protagonist. Each card will have a part of your life. The game is divided into four seasons (child, youth, adult, elderly). At the end of each cycle, the cards played are checked to know what really happens in the protagonist's life and that will not happen. Points are earned with the cards that were successful. At the end of the game, whoever has the most points is the winner.

Will the protagonists be able to have command of your own life and win in the end? Or is that the other players will determine how it will be his life?

This is a fast game, created for fun, involving a bit of memorization, bluff and strategy. And luck, of course, exists in all of our lives (or not!). Enjoy it!

Ps.: Sorry for my english. It isn't my native language.

134526.name: TrollsZine (Issue 6 - Fall 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Meszmyr Heldaer: A T&T NPC Portrait
Night Walk in the Wild Woods
The Toothpick vs the Broadsword: A T&T Combat Example
134526.description:
Publisher blurb:

"TrollsZine! #6 has landed!

The sixth issue of the fan-created magazine for Tunnels and Trolls, edited by Dan Hembree, contains 58 pages of quality content brought to you by the fans of the game for absolutely free.

This issue features two solo adventures, "Night Walk in the Wild Woods" by James Fallows and "Soul Survivor" by Sid Orpin; a GM adventure, "Ice Exile" by Mark Thornton; and a short story, "Old Kramm" by Roy Cram. TrollsZine! #6 also includes articles on obtaining food for adventurers; acquiring henchmen for solo delvers; alternate armor rules; an NPC elven wizard description; a short, one-room GM scenario; and more."

134527.name: Other Worlds Free Preview
134527.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Free Preview Edition of Other Worlds contains the full introduction chapter, a rules summary, character sheets, and an art preview.

Other Worlds is a roleplaying game of heroic action and adventure for any genre. The game is driven by description: descriptions of characters, details of actions, and dramatic visualisations. Numbers and dice rolls are secondary to the action; in fact, you will find that in Other Worlds the rules serve to emphasise the story and increase the drama rather than getting in their way.

134528.name: Sword's Edge (Issue 7 - Aug 2002)
rpgissuearticle: Eric S. Brown and Night Shopping
The Knight and Knave of Swords Review
The Planet of the Apes (2001) Review
134528.description:
Web release

Cover Illustration and Design by Bob Childers

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

134529.name: The Simurg
134529.description:
From the introduction:

The Simurg is an immortal creature, ancient beyond our understanding. It is the source of all that is, was, and will be. Deep within its lair the Simurg slumbers, and dreams. Those dreams become our hopes and our sorrows.

It is said that the Simurg will make a gift of three of its feathers upon true believers, those brave enough to attempt the journey to its lair. Upon these feathers are writ the dreams of the world, and in a time of greatest need they may be burned to invoke the Simurg's wisdom and power.

The tides of Fate are the Simurg's to command, and it is said that if the bravest of the brave should be true enough to find the Simurg that it will grant an audience and a boon. So go forth brave ones, believers, and wake the Simurg!

134530.name: Tac-Tic' Flip
134530.description:
Looks like a Connect 4 Launchers but reduced to a single deck.

Players each have sixteen chips they try to shoot to board in proper holes in their turn.
Player who get 4 in a row is the winner.

134531.description:
Who will win Employee of the Day? Deal with customers, the register, shipping and stocking. The 18 hour day begins with a roll of the dice . . .

2 players, 3d6 and 20 markers per player :: the player with the most VP at game end wins!

Setup: Decide who is Player 1 and Player 2. Each player takes 20 markers in one color. Next, lay the cards out in a line between players, in order from (1)-(6), creating the game store. One of the players places a marker on the 17 space on the (6) card. Player 1 begins.

Play: Players take turns rolling/re-rolling 3d6 up to three times, keeping any dice they wish during each roll (you may re-roll previously kept dice except for any 6s). Once the 3 dice rolls are done, the player can apply any die or set of dice to match various options on the game store cards. Players will place markers of their color on the cards over the smaller dice and cube icons. Each die rolled has a different meaning in the game.

Game End: Total each player’s VP. The player with the most VP wins. In the case of a tie, whichever player has majority on the [1] card is the winner.

This is the 2nd in a series of Annual Games Unlimited Holiday Games (2012) and is the followup to Gameshop Express (2011)
134531.name: Gameshop Workday

134532.name: Birdorama
134532.description:
Introduction from the rules sheet:
Birdorama can be played by one person as a 'Patience', or by 2, 3 or 4 players. In each case the principle is the same - to build up a 'panoramic' picture, three pieces deep, in which each piece contributes to the scene by correctly joining and continuing from its neighbours at all touching edges, as in a jig-saw.

Birdorama can be played by 2, 3 or 4 players. Each player takes 9 tiles (plus the 'Rarity' tile) at random from his set of 24 to make his hand. Players take turn to lay tiles (in legal positions) until either one player lays his last tile or no-one can lay a legal tile. Tiles left in the hand are then scored, and the winner is the player with the fewest points.

134533.name: Objects Below the Shattered Moon, Volume 2
134533.description:
From publisher blurb:

After the cracking of the moon and before the rise of Atlantis the world was a place strange to the thoughts of honest men. The death throes of science amid the birth of magic sculpted new generations of conquerors who strode the lands forging civilizations of steel, sinew, and sorcery from the decrepit hulks of the ones that fell before. Tyrannical wizards, amoral super-scientists, charismatic catalysts, and multifarious mutants battled for wealth, power, and honor. It was ten thousand years of barbarity; ten thousand years spent in the shadowy shells of past glories, hiding from horrible creatures that scratched and skittered for blood; ten thousand years of tyranny and injustice, ten thousand years of Sorcery & Super Science!

This short PDF provides a harried GM with 1 new sorcerous artifact, 6 miscellaneous items, 1 new robot, 1 new vehicle, and 66 lesser miscellaneous items suitable for various power levels and certain to bring additional life to the world under the shattered moon.

134534.name: Objects Below the Shattered Moon, Volume 3
134534.description:
From publisher blurb:

After the cracking of the moon and before the rise of Atlantis the world was a place strange to the thoughts of honest men. The death throes of science amid the birth of magic sculpted new generations of conquerors who strode the lands forging civilizations of steel, sinew, and sorcery from the decrepit hulks of the ones that fell before. Tyrannical wizards, amoral super-scientists, charismatic catalysts, and multifarious mutants battled for wealth, power, and honor. It was ten thousand years of barbarity; ten thousand years spent in the shadowy shells of past glories, hiding from horrible creatures that scratched and skittered for blood; ten thousand years of tyranny and injustice, ten thousand years of Sorcery & Super Science!

This short PDF provides a harried GM with new sorcerous artifacts, firearms, armors and shields, a few lesser miscellaneous items, as well as a comprehensive accounting of the different types of field rations found on the world below the shattered moon.

134535.name: Creatures Below the Shattered Moon, Volume 4
134535.description:
From publisher blurb:

After the cracking of the moon and before the rise of Atlantis the world was a place strange to the thoughts of honest men. The death throes of science amid the birth of magic sculpted new generations of conquerors who strode the lands forging civilizations of steel, sinew, and sorcery from the decrepit hulks of the ones that fell before. Tyrannical wizards, amoral super-scientists, charismatic catalysts, and multifarious mutants battled for wealth, power, and honor. It was ten thousand years of barbarity; ten thousand years spent in the shadowy shells of past glories, hiding from horrible creatures that scratched and skittered for blood; ten thousand years of tyranny and injustice, ten thousand years of Sorcery & Super Science!

This short PDF provides a harried GM with 18 new creatures, suitable for various power levels and certain to bring additional life to the world under the shattered moon.

134536.name: Creatures Below the Shattered Moon, Volume 5
134536.description:
From publisher blurb:

After the cracking of the moon and before the rise of Atlantis the world was a place strange to the thoughts of honest men. The death throes of science amid the birth of magic sculpted new generations of conquerors who strode the lands forging civilizations of steel, sinew, and sorcery from the decrepit hulks of the ones that fell before. Tyrannical wizards, amoral super-scientists, charismatic catalysts, and multifarious mutants battled for wealth, power, and honor. It was ten thousand years of barbarity; ten thousand years spent in the shadowy shells of past glories, hiding from horrible creatures that scratched and skittered for blood; ten thousand years of tyranny and injustice, ten thousand years of Sorcery & Super Science!

This short PDF provides a harried GM with 19 new creatures, suitable for various power levels and certain to bring additional life to the world under the shattered moon.

134537.name: Characters Below the Shattered Moon, Volume 2
134537.description:
From publisher blurb:

After the cracking of the moon and before the rise of Atlantis the world was a place strange to the thoughts of honest men. The death throes of science amid the birth of magic sculpted new generations of conquerors who strode the lands forging civilizations of steel, sinew, and sorcery from the decrepit hulks of the ones that fell before. Tyrannical wizards, amoral super-scientists, charismatic catalysts, and multifarious mutants battled for wealth, power, and honor. It was ten thousand years of barbarity; ten thousand years spent in the shadowy shells of past glories, hiding from horrible creatures that scratched and skittered for blood; ten thousand years of tyranny and injustice, ten thousand years of Sorcery & Super Science!

This short PDF provides a harried GM with new highlights, 7 new whispers, and 18 new powers, mutations or spells. Any of these additions should find a quick home in any Sorcery & Super Science game!

134538.name: Worlds Apart Core Rulebook
134538.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome, traveler, to Worlds Apart! Brave the Forever Sea in a fantasy game of trade and exploration. Take the role of soldier or sailor, entertainer or scholar, dweomercraefter or drifter. A thousand thousand islands populate the world and riches, adventure, and danger lurks upon every shore!

"Four islands composed the sultry chain, floating upon a bright blue sea under a tropical sun, each island gradually decreasing size as the eye passed from north to south. They were mountainous, etched with deep valleys, and covered with lush foliage. Greysolt surveyed the chain as best he could with his spyglass, taking the longest time upon the southernmost island, covered in a hazy steam of warm clouds. The crew of The Dromedary remained silent as the Captain surveyed what no other voyagers had ever seen. Each held different thoughts in the silence: thoughts of receptive natives, thoughts of fresh water and fresh fruit, thoughts of spices unknown to the civilized world, thoughts of slaughter and pillage.

The crew was a motley sort, a dozen or so hardened men and women in their late 30’s. Each had another life behind them; some, several different lives. They were unreliable in the mainstay, but rock-solid in a clutch. They bickered and feuded as they worked, helping each other make The Dromedary move, breath, and live. Their ship was not just a thing of wood and artifice, it was a collection of elemental powers: it was a voyager ship.

Greysolt declared the all clear indicating an isolated cove to drop anchor, and the crew jumped into action. Several went into the hull to tend to the elementals bound within eldritch machinery, but most headed towards their cabins, gathering various equipment for the coming landing. The cove beckoned, the unknown called.

The Dromedary calmly pulled into the bay and slowed to drop anchor. Two dinghies plopped into the water, and their crew descended into the rocking ships. Crossbows ready, the small craft rowed to the black sand shores. Behind the shores a seemingly impenetrable wall of vegetation dazzled in a multi-colored display. Now, to heed the call…

134540.name: Stadt der Finsternis
134540.description:
user summary

This is the German edition of the Deadlands supplement/boxed set City o' Gloom, which gives a thorough description of Salt Lake City and Deseret. It also contains additional information for playing mad scientists.

134541.description:

The outer part contains outgame information and is separately numbered from the inner part, which contains ingame articles.

134547.name: Hikyō na kōmori
134547.description:
Hikyō na kōmori ("Cowardly Bat") is a card game of bluffing in which players try to piggy-back on other players' cards to score the most points.

All cards are dealt to the players. Each round players take turns playing a card on the table one by one and announce whether it is a Beast or a Bird. Cards may be played face up or face down, and players are free to lie about the card they have played. After each player has a card on the table, face-down cards are revealed and the outcome of the round is determined:


If all cards are the same type: Everyone wins a point.
If cards are of two types, then if there are only Beasts and Birds, the side with the most cards wins a point. If, however, there are Bats and anything else, the side that is not the Bats wins a point.
If cards are of all three types, then if there is a majority of Beasts or Birds, the side with the most cards and the Bats get a point. Otherwise if the number of Beasts and Birds is the same, they all get a point and the Bats get nothing.


Play continues until players run out of cards. The player with the most points wins.

134548.name: Awmrie
134548.description:
From publisher blurb:

Awmrie is composed of several dozen islands forming an extended archipelago stretching almost 200 miles over crystal clear, blue water. None of the islands are very large, the largest being only 300 or so square miles. In general, the islands of Awmrie tend towards flatness, sloping gently upwards towards their centers. Most islands are lined with sandy beaches shaded by palms of all sorts. Awmrie is divided into four major areas. In addition, two small and unique islands are worthy of attention.

Awmrie is a 3 page gazetteer detailing one of the islands in the Lyart Subsector in Worlds Apart. Welcome to the home island of the Durangwa! This heavily populated and civilized island contains secrets within secrets!

134549.name: Deave
134549.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deave is composed of two large islands (The Isle of the Dead and Chernivisti), one secondary island (Caerlaen), and a handful of tertiary islands called the Inner Islands. The lands are mountainous in their center and hilly on the periphery. There are numerous valleys, but tend towards smallness. The only real flatlands in Deave are found along the east coasts of Chernivisti and Caerlaen, where the land remains level for almost a full 30 miles from the coast.

Deave is a 3 page gazetteer detailing one of the islands in the Lyart Subsector in Worlds Apart. Deave was once the home of an ancient society, but a necromantic apocalypse has resulted in a dangerous and treacherous land!

134550.name: Gryce
134550.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gryce is a warm, tropical archipelago. It is composed of ten significant islands and many islands of smaller size. The islands tend towards the mountainous and there are many hidden valleys. The islands of Gryce have about them the feeling of the primordial— the beaches, when you can find them between the many mangrove swamps, are welcoming and wide, but the interior lands are rugged
and moody.

There are many volcanic cones throughout Gryce. None are active except for three on the island of the Umpana, two on Kilawa and one on Otura. Most of the time a single volcano is erupting, but sometimes two erupt together. Such paired eruptions are of significantly less magnitude than when a single erupts and this suggests that all six of the volcanoes are somehow joined.

A unique geologic feature of Gryce is The Steams. The Steams is a geologically active area stretching off the west coast of the islands known by the Greeoso (Tarthar, Koloroe, Kelmain, Toroe and Tiha). Below the shallow water (only 150 feet deep at the deepest) many small vents and fumaroles push above the seafloor, superheating the water to such a degree that the entire area is actually boiling. This creates a massive wall of steam over 100 miles wide at the widest. The area is impassable, for any voyager ship that enters is quickly shunted to the Forever Sea as it almost immediately loses sight of land amidst the steam

Legends speak of a strange and horrid island lost in The Steams...

Gryce is a 3 page gazetteer detailing one of the islands in the Lyart Subsector in Worlds Apart. Gryce is wild, empty, and mostly unexplored.

134551.name: Worlds Apart Suppliers
134551.description:
From publisher blurb:

One of the more common GM duties in Worlds Apart is creating the inventory of suppliers from which the PCs buy or sell. Worlds Apart Suppliers exists to make that process as fast as possible, as well as to cover instances when the players surprise you by suddenly deciding to do some trading.

Within you’ll find 36 different trade packages for standard goods and each island type. Using these packages, you can instantly determine what an individual supplier has available with a two rolls as opposed to several. This will speed play and allow you to do more with less planning. Additionally, three d66 tables list names, as well as the most prominent personal characteristic of the supplier, in case you need a quick NPC sketch if the players are interested in more than just buying goods.

134552.name: Crashmo
134552.description:
User Summary

A Sequel to Pushmo, Crashmo takes the same sort of block sliding platforming puzzle game but increases the complexity. Now instead of just pulling blocks out 1 to 3 steps, you move the blocks right, left, front and back, and unsupported blocks fall. New complications are added, including magic doors and floating blocks, and you have to figure out which order to drop things in order to reach the goal.

134553.name: eXceed 3rd - Jade Penetrate
134553.description:
User Summary

Exceed 3rd is a bullet hell game by Tennen-Sozai. Its mechanics are built around "speed-killing" enemies and grazing enemy bullets in order to build up a powerful special attack.

134554.name: eXceed 2nd - Vampire
134554.description:
Featuring the renowned and addictive polarity-based gameplay system, this amazing vertical shmup is sure to please any shooter fan. The polarity and color of your character can be changed to absorb enemy bullets of the same polarity while charging the special weapon in the process and doing double damage to enemies of the opposite polarity. Every bullet absorbed charges your special weapon for total destruction. With awesome music, beautiful art, and challenging stages, this is the game that put the eXceed series on the map and has everything you would want from a shmup.

Source: The Developer Website.

134555.name: Cadbury Air Race
134555.description:
Game published on the back cover to the Knockout Fun Book in 1956.

The rules: To play this thrilling game, you need a die, a dice cup (an egg-cup will do) and some coloured counters or buttons for aeroplanes {one for each player). Any number of players can take part, and the first to touch down on square 52 is the winner. With your last throw of the die you must get the exact number to reach 52 - if you throw too high a number you must wait another turn. We're sure that you’ll enjoy this game as much as you enjoy Cadburys Milk Cnocolate.

134559.description:
Tower is a set collection game for 2-4 players who want to race to beat their opponents to stores and buy the resources they need before the stores are out of stock. Resources are purchased with jewels, which players draw from the black bag at the start of their turns. The players then use their purchased resources to construct segments of the tower. The first player to construct all three of his tower segments wins!

A big theme of Tower is scarcity of resources, with only 18 resources in a four-player game. It's likely that in any given play session there will be enough resources for only one player, forcing everyone to play dirty in order to come out on top.

The black market provides a source for players to hire thugs to carry out some pretty shady actions. These range from intimidation, to stealing resources from other players, and robbing Salil, the tax collector. It's a dirty job, but it's necessary in order to succeed in Tower.
134559.name: Tower
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 38 Tower Time
The Game of Crowd Funding Ben Haskett Interview 02-19-2014

134560.name: Kill the Wizard
134560.description:
From the back of the book:

It's good to be the drow

The noble houses of Menzoberranan share a common enemy. An elf wizard has built a drow-slaying construct that he plans to release into the Underdark. Your job is to destroy the construct and kill the wizard...and bring victory and glory to your house.

134561.name: My Kingdom for the Princess III
134561.description:
In the third part of everybody's favorite game, you will find familiar landscapes and a very interesting game play combining the features of time management, simulation, and strategy.

Now there are three heroes fighting for the beautiful princess' hand. They are Arthur and Helen's sons who have all chosen the same woman to become their wife. You will have to figure out which one is worth to receive Elizabeth's hand in marriage! To do this, you would need to perform multiple tasks, survive treachery, and save the country from ruin.

here will be some surprises:
- Your workers are more diligent
- Buildings bring in more resources
- Five magical artifacts
- Unexpected bonuses
- More charming mini games
- New colorful interface
- Unique trophies
- Beautiful comics
- Well balanced levels, that gradually become more challenging
- A wonderful new castle to build - this time with a bear!

Source: The Publisher Website.

134565.name: Abiegnus
134565.description:
This Looney Pyramid game uses Volcano mechanics in an arrangment and manner inspired by Enochian Chess. Abiegnus is played on a 5x4 board that is set up to emulate the Tablet of Union from the system of angelic magic developed by Elizabethan adepts John Dee and Edward Kelly.

The name Abiegnus is from the mystical mountain of the Rosicrucian brotherhood.

Options and variants for this game include solitaire and competetive play, divination (fortune-telling), and different color schemes to support variant occult traditions.

134566.name: Run with the Pack
134566.description:
Run with the Pack is a fast paced card game of survival. The game takes place over the course of a single night in the forest. Players start out as lone wolves and fight to have the largest pack by the time the sun comes up.

The goal of Run with the Pack is to build your wolf pack and have the highest amount of wolves when the deck is exhausted. This is done by attracting wolves with Prey cards and gaining them into your pack by using Howl or Calls in the Night cards. You can also attack the other players’ packs by using Intimidate cards.

134567.name: Auction House
134567.description:
Auction House is a game for 2-6 players played over 2-3 turns where 6 lots are bid for each turn. For each lot players submit a secret value token that collectively equals the value for that lot. Players then bid in turn until all but one player have passed. The value is then revealed. If the value is greater than the bid, the winner moves the difference forward on the track. If the value is less he moves back. The winner collects the item token.

After six lots have been auctioned a new turn is commenced with players taking back their value tokens and lots returned for new bids. At the end of the agreed number of turns, the player furthest in profit wins.

The game is hand made from wood and comes in its own self contained hinged box with the board carved onto the lid.

134568.name: Novanta minuti
134568.description:
From the English version's introduction (Translation by Giulia Barbano):

Ninety minutes
A game for 3 players about the relationship between a father and a son, and what could be their last chance to meet.

You haven't talked with your father in weeks. Nothing strange, really - several days can go by between calls, and you live a ninety minutes' drive apart, plus, you both have lives, anyway.

He never told you anything about what was slowly eating him away. He's a proud man - or maybe he didn't want to have you worrying about nothing.

The hospital called. A doctor informed you that your father might have one, two hours left to breathe, at most.

You quit everything you were doing, grabbed your keys, and started your car. There's a ninety minutes' drive between you and your father.

From the original Italian introduction:

Novanta minuti
Un gioco sulla relazione fra un padre e un figlio, e sull'ultima occasione che potrebbero avere di rivedersi.

Non senti tuo padre da qualche settimana. Niente di strano, capita spesso che passino diversi giorni senza una telefonata, e in fondo abitate a novanta minuti di auto l'uno dall'altro, e ognuno ha la sua vita.

Non ti ha mai detto niente di ciò che lo stava lentamente divorando. È un uomo orgoglioso, o forse non voleva farti preoccupare per nulla... Adesso una telefonata dall'ospedale, e un medico ti fa sapere che tuo padre potrebbe avere non più di un'ora, forse due di respiro.

Hai lasciato tutto a metà, hai preso le chiavi e sei partito. Novanta minuti di auto ti separano da tuo padre.

134569.name: Gregs Tagebuch: Eier Matsch
134569.description:
Nobody wants to be holding the egg (= an egg-shaped, battery-powered timer) when it cracks. To get rid of it, the active player has to name a word that fits a category from the current card, e.g. "pizza toppings". He/she then passes it on to the next player or returns it to the player he/she got it from. The player who is holding the egg when it makes a cracking sound loses the current round. He/she gets the current topic card and starts a new round by turning over the top card from the stack.
A player who has collected three cards is eliminated from the game. The game continues until there is only one player left. This player wins the game.
If a player uses a word that another player has already used this round (and the other players notice), he has to keep the egg until he/she can think of another suitable word.

134570.name: Diamanttjuven
134570.description: Diamanttjuven (Diamond thief) is a stand-alone sequel to Afrikan tähti, where the fiamond is stolen from the owner of the diamond, a princess. But out there in the dark all thieves looking alike, and there will be a number of thieves. By rolling a spinner you will get the possibility to either draw a card, drive your pink car or do both. The aim of the game is to catch thieves.

- front cover

134572.name: The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: Moria & Angmar
boardgameexpansion: The Lord of the Rings: Strategy Battle Game
boardgamefamily: The Lord of the Rings: Strategy Battle Game
134572.description:
The Misty Mountains have ever been home to evil things. From the malicious Goblins that prey on unsuspecting Dwarves, to the colossal might of the Balrog of Morgoth, the Mines of Moria are a dangerous place to be at the best of times. Many travellers choose to avoid the route altogether, but instead find themselves confronted by the twisted armies of Angmar, a dark and forbidding land that's home to Trolls, Wargs and Undead spirit creatures kept alive by the will of the Witch King.

This 48-page Sourcebook for The Lord of the Rings contains all the rules you'll need to field an army from Moria and Angmar (including Goblins, Trolls, Dragons, Undead spirits and the mighty Balrog), as well as detailed background information and scenarios.

You must possess a copy of The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game in order to use the contents of this book.

134574.name: MacGuffin
134574.description:
To bomb or not to bomb. That is the question.

In this little odd bluffing game, players need to avoid the bomb detonating. At the start of round, the start player chooses right or left and hands a face-down bomb to that player and announces the number on the card. But, the player can bluff as to what number is on the card. As the bomb proceeds around the table, players have to choose between adding to the bomb and passing it on or stopping and checking the bomb pile. If the sum of numbers on the cards is over 10, then the bomb goes off, and the player who try hand bomb cards over to next player takes all bomb cards.

At the end of game, a player who have most many bomb cards loses.

134577.name: The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: Kingdoms of Men
boardgameexpansion: The Lord of the Rings: Strategy Battle Game
boardgamefamily: The Lord of the Rings: Strategy Battle Game
134577.description:
It is the swords of Men that have protected Middle-earth for countless centuries against the vast armies of Sauron. From the Horse Lords of Rohan, to the White Tower of Gondor, these men fight to protect the Free People of Middle-earth and drive back the darkness from their lands.

This 48-page Sourcebook for The Lord of the Rings contains all the rules you'll need to field an army from the Kingdoms of Men (including army lists for Minas Tirith, Rohan, the Fiefdoms, Arnor and Númenor), as well as detailed background information and scenarios.

You must possess a copy of The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game in order to use the contents of this book.

134578.name: The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: The Free Peoples
boardgameexpansion: The Lord of the Rings: Strategy Battle Game
boardgamefamily: The Lord of the Rings: Strategy Battle Game
134578.description:
Middle-earth is home to many races, most of them much older than the men that now dominate it. Amongst them are the Elves and the Dwarves, who have fought against Sauron and his armies for centuries. Though their experience in war is legendary, these races are now few in number, their time in Middle-earth close to an end. As such, their armies are often small, but comprised of powerful elite warriors, all of them ready to fight for the fate of Middle-earth.

This 64-page Sourcebook for The Lord of the Rings contains all the rules you'll need to field an army from The Free Peoples (including army lists for Elves, Dwarves, Hobbits, Ents, The Fellowship and the White Council), as well as detailed background information and scenarios.

You must possess a copy of The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game in order to use the contents of this book.

134579.name: The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: Mordor
boardgamefamily: The Lord of the Rings: Strategy Battle Game
134579.description:
Mordor is home to the mighty armies of the Dark Lord Sauron, a place of darkness and destruction, watched over by the Great Eye, and bathed in the fires of Mount Doom. It is through the Black Gates of Mordor that hundreds upon thousands of Orcs march, their goal: to conquer the entirety of Middle-earth and enslave the people that live there. Led by the powerful Nazgûl and supported by monstrous Trolls, the lands of Elves, Men and Dwarves will all fall to the might of Mordor and its vast armies. It is only a matter of time.

This 48-page Sourcebook for The Lord of the Rings contains all the rules you'll need to field an army of Mordor, as well as detailed background information and scenarios.

You must possess a copy of The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game in order to use the contents of this book.

134580.name: The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: The Fallen Realms
boardgameexpansion: The Lord of the Rings: Strategy Battle Game
boardgamefamily: The Lord of the Rings: Strategy Battle Game
134580.description:
There are many armies that fight for the Dark Lord, including several realms of men. Some, like the Easterlings, followed the path of darkness willingly and worship Sauron as a divine being; whereas others were cast out of their homes and fight alongside it him out of revenge - men such as the Haradrim. Amongst these mighty armies of Evil Men lie the Uruk-hai, a different race altogether. Bred in the fire pits beneath the fortress of Isengard, they are stronger, braver and better armoured than any Orc could ever hope to be. With these armies fighting alongside those of Mordor, there is little hope for the Free People of Middle Earth.

This 48-page Sourcebook for The Lord of the Rings contains all the rules you'll need to field an army from The Fallen Realms (including the Uruk-hai, Haradrim, Easterlings and the Variags of Khand), as well as detailed background information and scenarios.

You must possess a copy of The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game in order to use the contents of this book.

134587.name: Mage: Legacies - Introductory Guide
134587.description:
From Introduction:

As you may have noticed, this isn’t your standard roleplaying game. We’ve taken everything you’ve ever loved about roleplaying and live theatre and brought every element into live, vivid, HD color, screaming at you until you can taste the blood and see the brain matter as real as your imagination will allow.

Dark Legacies (the game this booklet was designed for) is a game of Conspiratorial Horror/Survival. We’ve taken the best elements from each theme to make the darkest, most twisted game we could imagine - which is why we ask that only mature gamers play our games.

This is NOT about Storytelling
We don’t consider Dark Legacies a Storytelling game. It isn’t that simple actually. What we do consider it is new, revolutionary and inventive. We don’t want you sitting around with your friends listening to just one guy talk while you roll some dice and call that “fun.” We want you on the edge of your seat, plotting against your best friends, always thinking of how you’re going to best that Werewolf at the bar from the last encounter or how you’re going to sneak around the rules of the Great House.

Getting Started
Grab a couple of your friends, a Character & Demo Scene or Introductory Guide like this one and see what unfolds. All you need is your imagination, a little time and some depravity (just kidding). But seriously, the most important component to Dark Legacies is the ability to play Rock, Paper, Scissors. If you can do that and some simple math, you’re good to go.

134588.name: Werewolf: Shapeshifters - Introductory Guide
134588.description:
From Introduction:

As you may have noticed, this isn’t your standard roleplaying game. We’ve taken everything you’ve ever loved about roleplaying and live theatre and brought every element into live, vivid, HD color, screaming at you until you can taste the blood and see the brain matter as real as your imagination will allow.

Dark Legacies (the game this booklet was designed for) is a game of Conspiratorial Horror/Survival. We’ve taken the best elements from each theme to make the darkest, most twisted game we could imagine - which is why we ask that only mature gamers play our games.

This is NOT about Storytelling
We don’t consider Dark Legacies a Storytelling game. It isn’t that simple actually. What we do consider it is new, revolutionary and inventive. We don’t want you sitting around with your friends listening to just one guy talk while you roll some dice and call that “fun.” We want you on the edge of your seat, plotting against your best friends, always thinking of how you’re going to best that Werewolf at the bar from the last encounter or how you’re going to sneak around the rules of the Great House.

Getting Started
Grab a couple of your friends, a Character & Demo Scene or Introductory Guide like this one and see what unfolds. All you need is your imagination, a little time and some depravity (just kidding). But seriously, the most important component to Dark Legacies is the ability to play Rock, Paper, Scissors. If you can do that and some simple math, you’re good to go.

134590.name: Vampire: Undeath - Introductory Guide
134590.description:
From Introduction:

As you may have noticed, this isn’t your standard roleplaying game. We’ve taken everything you’ve ever loved about roleplaying and live theatre and brought every element into live, vivid, HD color, screaming at you until you can taste the blood and see the brain matter as real as your imagination will allow.

Dark Legacies (the game this booklet was designed for) is a game of Conspiratorial Horror/Survival. We’ve taken the best elements from each theme to make the darkest, most twisted game we could imagine - which is why we ask that only mature gamers play our games.

This is NOT about Storytelling
We don’t consider Dark Legacies a Storytelling game. It isn’t that simple actually. What we do consider it is new, revolutionary and inventive. We don’t want you sitting around with your friends listening to just one guy talk while you roll some dice and call that “fun.” We want you on the edge of your seat, plotting against your best friends, always thinking of how you’re going to best that Werewolf at the bar from the last encounter or how you’re going to sneak around the rules of the Great House.

Getting Started
Grab a couple of your friends, a Character & Demo Scene or Introductory Guide like this one and see what unfolds. All you need is your imagination, a little time and some depravity (just kidding). But seriously, the most important component to Dark Legacies is the ability to play Rock, Paper, Scissors. If you can do that and some simple math, you’re good to go.

134591.name: John Ares: A New Character & Demo Scene
134591.description:
From Introduction:

Welcome Lost Traveler...
How far are you willing to go? When is dark too dark for you? Every Gamer has their own definition of what makes a game truly terrifying. Welcome to John Ares, a demo game for the Vampire enthusiast. As you peruse this packet we will introduce to you, John Ares, a 10,000 year old vampire who has his hands in many pots. If you truly wish to add this NPC to your Event, do so with a caution. In keeping with the traditions which surround G.A.M.E, John is someone who is not to be trifled with.

Whether you are a Director or a Gamer, the information you witness within this packet should be kept out-of-character.... enjoy.

134592.name: Mighty Flip Champs!
134592.description:
Mighty Flip Champs! is a puzzle platform video game, developed and published by WayForward Technologies for the Nintendo DSi's DSiWare digital download service. It was first announced on March 9, 2009, and was released on June 1, 2009 in North America and on November 27, 2009 in the PAL regions. The developers took inspiration from multiple sources, including the video games Wendy: Every Witch Way and The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past. In it, players control Alta, a girl who has to reach a fishman by flipping between areas until she can reach him. Since its release, Mighty Flip Champs! has received all-around positive reception. It holds an aggregate score of 83/100 and 83.50% from Metacritic and Game Rankings respectively, while also being called one of the best video games for the DSiWare service. It is the first game in the Mighty series, and is followed by Mighty Milky Way and Mighty Switch Force.
The game has been ported to PlayStation 3 and PlayStation Portable via the PlayStation Network as a PlayStation Mini under the title Mighty Flip Champs! DX. It was released in North America on July 12, 2011.

Mighty Flip Champs! is a puzzle/platform game hybrid, requiring players to explore stages that vary from having two areas to up to eight areas. The objective is to get the player-character, Alta, through the stage and to find the Fishman. Later in the game, levels will add characters that Alta must find before she may exit the stage. Alta has only two abilities: movement and flipping. Movement requires use of the Nintendo DS' directional pad, allowing Alta to move only left or right. The player controls Alta on the top screen, with another area being shown on the bottom screen with a mirror image of Alta shown. Players are able to flip to a different screen by pushing a button. When these screens are flipped, the area on the bottom screen will appear on the top screen; depending on the number of areas, the top area will be moved to the bottom area, or a new area will be revealed. If Alta does not have any footing to land on, she will fall, though uninjured. If there is an obstacle in the way while flipping, she will lose and the level will end. Some special stages exist where Alta cannot flip the screen, and is at the whim of a clock which flips the screen every so often. Once a stage is completed, the players are shown their time and an accompanying rank, the highest being an "S".

Source: Wikipedia, "Mighty Flip Champs!", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

134593.name: Mighty Milky Way
134593.description:
Mighty Milky Way is an action puzzle video game for the Nintendo DSi. It is the second title after Mighty Flip Champs! in the "Mighty" series from WayForward Technologies. The game was released for download through DSiWare on May 9, 2011 in North America and May 27, 2011 in Europe.

In this game, you help Luna, a French speaking alien who is able to break planets with a baton and create planets with planet candy. In the last level of each world, Luna must escape a laser shooting robot T-Rex.

Source: Wikipedia, "Mighty Milky Way", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

134594.name: Players Association News (Issue 3 - July 1981)
134594.description:
"A bi-monthly newspaper for all D&D and AD&D enthusiasts"
- front cover

"It is only available free to members of the D&D Players Association. It is not for resale."
- credits, page 2

134595.name: Analysis
134595.description:
Analysis is a game of deduction in which players take turns being the Analyst, the person responsible for choosing and (using the game's components) outlining a character, Man or Woman, Living or Dead, Real or Fictional, for the remaining players to deduce. Points are scored based on how well the Analyst describes the character before the mystery is solved, or by players who successfully determine the character's identity. A score of 500 wins the game.

The game's equipment consists of 25 descriptive cards, some small round plastic chips, a playing board with categorical areas (Personality, Profession, Geographical Location, Physical Description) and their point values on which the cards are to be placed, and a smaller "key" board with more detailed subsets of the board's categories and point values, where the chips are placed.

134596.name: Duple
boardgamepodcastepisode: 28 – The Family Gamers Podcast – Boston FIG Tabletop games
35 – The Family Gamers Podcast – Budget-Friendly Games
134596.description:
Quick! Think of a word that contains both letters on the table! An animal that has an L and a D? Leopard! A place containing and R and B? Barnyard! How about a verb with a P and an E?....Explode!

Duple is a quick-thinking game of symbol matching and word-finding. Players flip letter cards in turn until the symbols on two players' cards match. Matching players face-off by being the first to shout a word which contains the letters on both cards.

Sound easy? Think again! Correct answers must be at least 5 letters long and conform to ever-changing categories. Wild Cards and Cascades create unexpected face-offs and the All Play card gets everyone facing off a once!

134597.name: Casino of Corruption
134597.description:
publisher blurb

A mysterious series of crimes plagues the city! A new group of gambling-themed villains are staging daring robberies, but there is more than meets the eye to these new crimes and criminals, a connection the an underground casino where patrons bet their lives and very souls!
Casino of Corruption is an adventure for ICONS Super-Powered Roleplaying, featuring gambling-themed villains under the influence of the sinister "Mr. Jack". Do the heroes have what it takes to bet against the Devil himself? Find out in... the Casino of Corruption!

134599.name: Players Association News (Issue 4 - Sep 1981)
rpgissuearticle: ... of all the world's great heroes ...
134599.description:
"A bi-monthly newspaper for all D&D and AD&D enthusiasts"
- front cover

Nikolas Lloyd was not given a credit in this issue for his illustration. But the illustration clearly shows a NL signature, and he was given credit retroactively for this issue, in PAN #6.

134600.name: Angry Birds: Western Round-Up
134600.description:
This game one of the many games in the Angry Birds Series.

Build, launch and destroy with this Angry Birds Western Round-Up Game by Mattel. Create structures based on mission cards. Shoot down your opponent's structures to score points. Reach 1,000 points first to win.

134601.name: Angry Birds: Space – Planet Block Version
134601.description:
This game one of the many games in the Angry Birds Series.

Build, blast and lift-off with this exciting addition to the Angry Birds Space collection! Players still try to build structures indicated by the cards before opponents can knock them down, but a new planet launcher and construction pieces allow for exciting variability and new play. Game features new birds and pigs from one of the best-selling digital apps.

134602.name: Angry Birds: Mega Fling
134602.description:
This game one of the many games in the Angry Birds Series.

Build, launch and destroy with an exciting skill-and-action game based on the best-selling digital app Angry Birds! Players draw a mission card and build the structure shown before their opponents launch an Angry Bird in an attempt to knock it – and the pigs – down to win points.

134603.name: Alice Chess
boardgameversion: English  "Chessery for Duffer and Master" edition
134603.description:
Alice Chess is one of the more popular chess variants. David Pritchard's Encyclopedia of Chess Variants recommends it as one of the best chess variants.

It was created by V. R. Parton, who described his variant in his 23-page booklet "Chessery for Duffer and Master" (1953).

The standard game of Alice Chess is played using two boards, A and B. All pieces move as in standard chess. The normal array is on board A; board B starts empty.

In turn, each player makes a single move on either board following these three rules:

1. A move must be legal on the board where it is played.
2. A piece can only move or capture if the corresponding destination square on the other board is vacant.
3. After moving, the piece is transfered to the corresponding square on the other board.

(Thus a square and its corresponding square on the other board are never both occupied.)

134605.description:
This Chinese edition of Summoner Wars Starter pack is published by Wargames Club Publishing. The starter pack provides core materials for 1 player, containing a rulebook, 20 damage tokens, and 1 battlefield mapboard of 1 player-side. The mapboard is produced of equal or better quality level as the english version of Premium Set mapboard. Players are required to purchase separate faction packs to play the game.

[Chinese]
在召喚師戰爭中你扮演一個召喚師的角色。你被召喚之石賦
予呼喚強大勇士和施展強力法術的能力，以在你與一個敵對
的召喚師的戰鬥中幫助你。遊戲的目的是摧毀你對手的召喚師
卡。當你是遊戲中唯一擁有召喚師卡在場中的玩家時，你就勝
出了。

遊戲部件
1 本說明書• 單人份戰場圖板• 20個傷害標誌


派系套牌會獨立上市*
134605.name: 召喚師戰爭：起始套裝
boardgameexpansion: 召喚師戰爭: 公會矮人派系套牌
召喚師戰爭: 冰原獸人派系套牌
召喚師戰爭: 暗影精靈派系套牌
召喚師戰爭: 沙地哥布林派系套牌
召喚師戰爭: 洞穴哥布林派系套牌
召喚師戰爭: 深處矮人 派系套牌
召喚師戰爭: 神通族派系套牌
召喚師戰爭: 鳳凰精靈派系套牌

134607.description:
A set of 30 holiday themed cards for Cards Against Humanity.

24 white & 6 black cards.
All profits donated to Wikimedia.
134607.name: Cards Against Humanity: Holiday Expansion
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode Twenty-Seven: Mad Against Humanity

134608.name: Cerebremorte & Cognition Devil
134608.description:
From publisher blurb:

In 2011, Dreamscarred Press held a contest for a psionic bestiary. The monsters from that contest are being released in a series of releases and will ultimately be compiled into a single psionic bestiary book.

In this release of the Psionic Bestiary are two monsters, the cerebremorte and the cognition devil, one an undead spirit of a powerful manifester, the other an evil outsider who strives to bring out the savage side of civilized societies.

134609.name: Four More!
134609.description:
From publisher blurb:

In 2011, Dreamscarred Press held a contest for a psionic bestiary. The monsters from that contest are being released in a series of releases and will ultimately be compiled into a single psionic bestiary book.

In this release of the Psionic Bestiary are four psionic monsters, the Ir’LLanthaal, Khurduzal, Saurood, and Therchias Hound, two species of humanoid psionic creatures, a psionic plant, and a six-legged beast.

134610.name: Pyn-Gok & Tartys
134610.description:
From publisher blurb:

In 2011, Dreamscarred Press held a contest for a psionic bestiary. The monsters from that contest are being released in a series of releases and will ultimately be compiled into a single psionic bestiary book.

In this release of the Psionic Bestiary are two psionic monsters, the pyn-gok, a race of creatures resembling peacocks, and the tartys, a psionic race of fey who revel in sowing discord and dissension.

134611.name: Game Geek (Issue 36 - Dec 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Aces & Eights: Bad Day at Buena Roca
134611.description:
Game Geek
Issue #36
December 2012

Cover art by Joseph J. Calkins

134612.name: Ion Guard (BASH!)
134612.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to ION Guard, the first issue of ION Space, a series of licensed supplements for BASH! Ultimate Edition by Basic Action Games!

The Intergalactic Ordinance Network (ION) Guard is a heroic peacekeeping organization that has served to protect and defend the intelligent species of the many sectors of the Universe for the last billion years.

Each Guardsman - wearing the iconic golden ION Fist that has become synonymous with justice for many intergalactic inhabitants - is a cosmic powerhouse, capable of bringing the vast forces of an artificially harnessed singularity to bear against the enemies of peace, justice, and life.

Throughout the Universe they strive against evil and darkness. Though powerful, they are spread all too thin: they are but small lights, beacons of hope in the vast darkness enfolding the stars.


ION Space will introduce alien species and empires, interplanetary organizations, and galactic empires, and cosmic threats. Each ION Space issue may be slotted into your existing BASH! campaign individually, or woven together to provide a vast and expanding outer space setting for your heroes to explore...and defend!

134613.name: Struggle For Troy
134613.description:
A two-player strategy board game based on the Trojan War. In the designer's words, "It takes the best of Memoir 44 and other such Hex based war games and changes things that were kind of pet peeves to me, such as the card based movement and the in-ability to fire back at an opponent while he if firing at you."

The board shows the land between the Aegean sea and the city of Troy. There is a Greek player whose goal is to put "undetermined" amount of units into the city of Troy. While the Trojan player defends his city by trying to burn all of the Greek player's ships.

Each player has a certain amount of archers, footmen, chariots equipped with horse and charioteer, and heroes with strength in offense or defense. Each different type of unit has a different movement, attack, defense, critical hit score, and range stat.

On a players turn, they can move as many of their units as they like as long as it complies with the unit's stats. They can also attack other units. To attack, they add the attacking units attack stat with the defending units defense stat. This creates the probability of rolling a hit on the 12-sided die. After the player attacks the defending player, the defending player has the option of retaliating with that same unit or retreating.

134614.name: Illuminati Endgame 2012
134614.description:
This game is about the historic struggle of the free peoples of the World against the control of the Illuminati.

There are two opposing teams in this game. On one side are the “Free Peoples” players who can only win or lose together. Their main goal is to survive. On the other side are the “Illuminati” players who must both the defeat the “Free Peoples” players and lastly also their team members to win the game individually. Illuminati players need to get as much power as possible. Nobody knows who belongs to which side at the start of the game.

Each player starts up in a province and can then expand his civilization. He can also upgrade the technology level. At the end of each turn calamities may occur. A player gets "power points" which he can use for his actions or save his provinces from the effects of these calamities, so a player must strike a balance between these two.

It's a tactical game with only a very small element of luck (the calamities at the end of each turn), so it becomes kind of like chess to plan your moves.

134615.description:
Draw a random race and class card and keep your identity a secret. Then you adventure into Zogar’s Dungeon and attempt to collect the objects you need to meet your two separate win conditions. You must enter the dungeon on your turn but you can leave whenever you want. Press your luck and try to collect as much loot as you can, but be aware, Zogar’s minions are wandering about and you might lose all you have gained if you perish. In addition Zogar’s all seeing eyes are protecting his lair and if too many are revealed, than every player loses and Zogar wins the game. Muhahahaha!

Do not fear; there is also a market where you can secretly turn in loot you do not need for items that can save your life from the dangers below.

This is a 1-4 player game where players attempt to meet certain win conditions based on their race and class. The first player to meet these conditions wins. Try and figure out who the other players are and attempt to slow them down. The game plays quickly with a 4 player game lasting between 30-45 minutes.
134615.name: Zogar's Gaze

134616.name: Pulce
134616.description:
A Halma variation for two players.

('Pulce' is the Italian word for 'flea'.)


Game components:


- A wooden board with 7 rows and 7 columns of sockets (a total of 45 holes, no holes in the four board corners).
- 8 black and 8 red pawns.
- 1 yellow pawn (first-player marker)


Game goal:


The objective of the game is to be the first player to get his pieces over to the opposite side of the board.

Set-up:


Two adjacent board sides (containing 10 sockets) are chosen as the destination field for one player's pawns (player A, positions 1b-1f and 2a-6a), while the opposite sides are assigned to the other player (player B, positions 7b-7f and 2g-6g). Players then placed all his pawns as follows: player A, sockets 4e, 4f, 5d, 5e, 5f, 6d, 6e, and 6f; player B, sokets 2b, 2c, 2d, 3, b, 3c, 3d, 4b, and 4c.
The yellow pawn is placed in the central socket (position 4d).


Game rules:


The game is played over three rounds.

On each round:

On player takes the yellow pawn and places it in front of him. He is the initial player of the current round and makes the first move. Game continues with every player moving a pawn alternatively.

During his turn, a player must move a pawn according to the following rules: pawns can be moved to an adjacent free socket or else jump (in any direction) over a pawn of whatever color onto a free socket behind it. The enemy destination sockets can not be used for jumping. Consecutive jumps are also allowed and the jump direction can be changed as desired during a series of consecutive jumps.

Important: the target sockets must be always accessed orthogonally, i.e., moving the pawn from a socket orthogonally adjacent to a destination socket or else jumping over an occupied socket orthogonally adjacent to the landing destination socket.

Pawns that have reach a destination socket cannot move any longer.

Game end and rating:

The round is over when a player has placed all his pawns in his destination sockets. If this player was the starting player, his opponent can make and additional move.
